name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Final Sign Off
Acceptance Criteria - All below requirements are met and approved by ER
Verifying Document - Referenced Item numbers as below
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Bitumen/binder compliant with NZTA M/1 - Table 5.1
Frequency - Minimum 5 working days prior to construction
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Maximum of 10% fines shall be produced under a load of 230kN.
Frequency - Three initially from stockpile then repeat for every 10,000m3 of source material used or once per annum, whichever is lesser
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - The aggregate shall have a quality index of AA or BA
Frequency - Three initially from stockpile then repeat for every 10,000m3 of source material used or once per annum, whichever is lesser
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Note - only required if source properties are disputed.
○ The aggregate shall have a maximum of 1% of unsound materials
Frequency - Three initially from stockpile then repeat for every 10,000m3 of source material used or once per annum, whichever is lesser
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Polished Stone Value (PSV) - compliant with NZTA M6: 2022: 4.6 & project requirements
Frequency - Three initially from stockpile then repeat for every 10,000m3 of source material used or once per annum, whichever is lesser
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Cleaness of aggregate samples compliant with NZTA M6: 2022 5.2 Cleanness
Frequency - Three initially per grade of chip from stockpile, then repeat as follows:
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Size and Shape of Aggregate Particles compliant with NZTA M6: 2022: 5.2 Size and Shape
Grade of Chip || ALD (mm) || % of Least Dimensions Within 2.5mm of ALD || AGD/ALD Ratio || % Passing 4.75mm Sieve || % With at Least Two Broken Faces
Frequency - Three initially per grade of chip from stockpile, then repeat as follows:
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Test Report Review
Acceptance Criteria - Particle Size Distribution compliant with NZTA M6: 2022 5.1 Table 4
Siege Size (mm) || Percentage Passing Sieve (Grade 5 :: Grade 6)
Frequency - Three initially per grade of chip from stockpile, then repeat as follows:
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Design Review
Acceptance Criteria - Designer to approve sealing design
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual Site Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Basecourse (prime seal) - To be prepped to a tight, uniform surface, swept to remove any dust and other foreign objects.
○ Prime or previouis seal - Full surface swept with a power broom to remove excess chip and any other foreign material
Frequency - Prior to construction of sealing coat
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Degree of Saturation test TNZB/02 Clause 12
Acceptance Criteria - Compliant as per TNZ B/02 Clause 12 DOS at each of minimim 5 points < 80%
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite check & Document

Acceptance Criteria - The road shall be reasonably dry before the binder is applied, and no spraying shall be carried out when the air temperature measured within the confines of the sealing course is below 10 degrees C in the shade
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite check & Document
Acceptance Criteria - Sprayed Rate measured compliant with the Approved Seal Design
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite check & Document
Acceptance Criteria - Sealing Records showing compliant spread rate of the chips based on C0213.5;TNZ P/3: 1995-21 Cl. 28
Frequency - 1 test per chip grade per 2,000m2 seal constructed
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite check & Document
Acceptance Criteria - Sealing Records showing compliant rolling requirements based on C0213.5;TNZ P/3: 1995-22 ROLLING
7.6.5 - On Site Checks - Post PTR and Brooming
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite check & Document
Acceptance Criteria - Surface Compliant and Surplus chip removed
Frequency - Prior to construction of next layer/ Prior removal of the temporary speed restriction signs
